io.github.vladast.avrcommunicator

Class Communicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.vladast.avrcommunicator.Communicator

  • public class Communicator
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    0.0.1 Main module used to establish connection with AVR device.
    Author:
    vladimir.stankovic

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private io.github.vladast.avrcommunicator.AvrRecorderDevice mAvrRecorderDevice
      Represents data read from AVR event-recorder device
      private io.github.vladast.avrcommunicator.OnAvrRecorderEventListener mAvrRecorderEventListener
      Instance of OnAvrRecorderEventListener for utilization of events
      private Handler mAvrRecorderMonitorHandler
      Instance of Handler class used for asynchronous even processing
      private boolean mRecordsRead
      Indicates whether recorded events were read from device or not
      private static int MSG_CHECK_DEVICE_STATUS
      Static member used for "check device status" message
      private static int MSG_DEVICE_DETECTED
      Static member used for "device detected" message
      private static int MSG_REINIT_DEVICE
      Static member used for "re-initialize device" message
      private UsbDeviceConnection mUsbDeviceConnection
      Instance of UsbDeviceConnection class, representing the actual connection between Android and AVR devices
      private UsbManager mUsbManager
      Instance of UsbManager class, being an Android's USB connection manager
      static java.lang.String TAG

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void checkDeviceStatus()
      Checks whether AVR device has been attached or not.
      static java.lang.String communicate(UsbDeviceConnection usbDeviceConnection)
      Proof of Concept method, used to communicate with USB-enabled device and retrieve all data.
      io.github.vladast.avrcommunicator.AvrRecorderDevice getDevice()
      Getter for mAvrRecorderDevice field.
      protected void readDeviceData(UsbDevice usbDevice)
      This method reads status header&codes and records from the device, respectively
      protected void readDeviceInfo()
      Reads device's status, state, session, and number of records.
      protected void readDeviceRecords()
      Reads event records from device.
      void registerListener(io.github.vladast.avrcommunicator.OnAvrRecorderEventListener onAvrRecorderEventListener)
      Method used to register event listener provided by upper layer.
      protected void reinitDevice()
      Sends USB control message for re-initialization of the device.
      void reInitiateDevice()
      Sends "re-initialize device" message to the handler, signaling that device re-initialization is being requested.
      void startDeviceDetection()
      Sends "check device status" message to the handler, notifying it that AVR's status (connected/disconnected) should be checked.
      void stopDeviceDetection()
      Removes "check device status" message from handler's queue, indicating that AVR's status should not be checked from now on.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Communicator

        public Communicator(UsbManager usbManager)
        Communicator class constructor
        Parameters:
        usbManager - UsbManager class instance received from upper layer when connection with AVR device is established.

    • Method Detail

      • getDevice

        public final io.github.vladast.avrcommunicator.AvrRecorderDevice getDevice()
        Getter for mAvrRecorderDevice field.

      • registerListener

        public void registerListener(io.github.vladast.avrcommunicator.OnAvrRecorderEventListener onAvrRecorderEventListener)
        Method used to register event listener provided by upper layer. All communication between Communicator class instance and upper layer is done via instantiated handler.
        Parameters:
        onAvrRecorderEventListener - Object reference from upper layer's implementation of OnAvrRecorderEventListener interface.

      • startDeviceDetection

        public void startDeviceDetection()
        Sends "check device status" message to the handler, notifying it that AVR's status (connected/disconnected) should be checked.

      • stopDeviceDetection

        public void stopDeviceDetection()
        Removes "check device status" message from handler's queue, indicating that AVR's status should not be checked from now on.

      • reInitiateDevice

        public void reInitiateDevice()
        Sends "re-initialize device" message to the handler, signaling that device re-initialization is being requested.

      • checkDeviceStatus

        protected void checkDeviceStatus()
        Checks whether AVR device has been attached or not.

      • reinitDevice

        protected void reinitDevice()
        Sends USB control message for re-initialization of the device. If completed successfully, AVR device will move to INIT state, awaiting for new events.

      • readDeviceData

        protected void readDeviceData(UsbDevice usbDevice)
        This method reads status header&codes and records from the device, respectively
        Parameters:
        usbDevice - Instance of UsbDevice representing connected USB-enabled device

      • readDeviceInfo

        protected void readDeviceInfo()
        Reads device's status, state, session, and number of records. With each value read from the device, mAvrRecorderDevice is being updated so that it reflect read data.

      • readDeviceRecords

        protected void readDeviceRecords()
        Reads event records from device. For each read event record, mAvrRecorderDevice field is being updated.

      • communicate

        public static java.lang.String communicate(UsbDeviceConnection usbDeviceConnection)
        Proof of Concept method, used to communicate with USB-enabled device and retrieve all data. Basically, it does same actions as host application from https://github.com/vladast/avr-based-event-recorder-with-usb-support
        Parameters:
        usbDeviceConnection - Instance of UsbDeviceConnection, representing established USB connection.
        Returns:
        String representation of console output with all read data (status, error-code, event records).
